pageContext.claim: “We're bringing them back [undocumented immigrants with crime records] to where they came from. And we're keeping them there and -- Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador -- so many of these countries. And, you know, in the past administration, they couldn't bring them back because they'd say, ‘No, no. You can't bring them back. Get out. You can't bring them back.’ So they'd fly over; they wouldn't let them land. They wouldn't let buses go in with these people. We'd would have to bring them back. They don't do that with us.”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, the Obama administration prioritized the deportations of gang members and individuals with criminal records. Thousands of such migrants were returned to El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras during the Obama administration, according to statistics from the Department of Homeland Security.
